body_html:
EINTR happens when a syscall is interrupted. It's application's responsibility to catch this and retry. The application here is Python as it happens (and we use) python's multiprocessing.Queue implementation.

So this is a python bug. Before 3.5, EINTR'ed syscalls are not automatically retried. We don't really have much that we can do from our side.

Therefore, it's unlikely that this error happens consistently for you.

Python patch: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0475/
Some discussions are in comments of this PR: #4643
Simply googling the error message also gives you tons of more detailed information from websites like stackoverflow.

Therefore, it's unlikely that this error happens consistently for you.
Python patch: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0475/
Some discussions are in comments of this PR: #4643
Simply googling the error message also gives you tons of more detailed information from websites like stackoverflow.
body:
EINTR happens when a syscall is interrupted. It's application's responsibility to catch this and retry. The application here is Python as it happens (and we use) python's multiprocessing.Queue implementation.

So this is a python bug. Before 3.5, EINTR'ed syscalls are not automatically retried. We don't really have much that we can do from our side. 

Therefore, it's unlikely that this error happens consistently for you. 

Python patch: https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0475/
Some discussions are in comments of this PR: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4643
Simply googling the error message also gives you tons of more detailed information from websites like stackoverflow.
